contextId.information: Here "him" actually refers to Adoni Bezek and his army. AT: "they fought against him and his army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

"with the point of the sword." Here "sword" represents the swords and other weapons that the soldiers used in battle. AT: "with their swords" or "with their weapons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: with the edge of the sword

contextId.information: "with the point of the sword." Here "sword" represents the swords and other weapons that the soldiers used in battle. AT: "with their swords" or "with their weapons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: with the edge of the sword

contextId.information: Here "he" refers to Othniel who represents the army of Israel. AT: "Othniel and the Israelite soldiers went to fight against the army of Cushan Rishathaim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Eglon king of Moab" represents his army. AT: "to Eglon king of Moab and his soldiers as they attacked the Israelite army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: to Eglon king of Moab to overpower the Israelites

contextId.information: Here "Sisera" represents his army. AT: "draw out Sisera and his army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

Here "sword" represents the swords and other weapons that the soldiers used in battle. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Barak and his soldiers killed Sisera's whole army with their swords" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the whole army of Sisera was killed by the edge of the sword

contextId.information: Here "him" refers to Jabin who represents his army. AT: "they destroyed Jabin and his army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "voices" represents the people singing. AT: "Listen to those" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

The king of a people group is used to refer to the army he commands. AT: "The kings and their armies came and fought ... the kings of Canaan and their armies fought" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: The kings came, they fought ... the kings of Canaan fought

contextId.information: Here "silver" represents any treasure in general. AT: "no silver or other treasures as plunder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "soul" refers to the whole person. The word "my" refers to Deborah. AT: "I tell myself to march on and to be strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: March on my soul, be strong

contextId.information: Here "necks" represents Sisera's soldiers. AT: "for the soldiers who plunder to wear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: for the necks of those who plunder

contextId.information: Here "the ears" refers to the whole person. AT: "proclaim to the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: proclaim in the ears of the people

contextId.information: Here "He" refers to Gideon. Gideon represents the soldiers following him. AT: "They left there" or "Gideon and his 300 men left there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "I" represents Gideon and his men. AT: "My men and I will pull down this tower" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I will pull down this tower

contextId.information: Here "Gideon" represents all of his soldiers. AT: "Gideon and his soldiers went up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Israel" represents the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Israel" represents the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Judah" and "Benjamin" refer to the people belonging to those tribes. AT: "the people of the tribe of Judah ... the people of the tribe of Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Israel" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "so that the people of Israel suffered much" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: so that Israel was greatly distressed

contextId.information: The messengers were sent by the leaders of Israel. AT: "When the leaders of Israel sent messengers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The messengers were sent by the leaders of Israel. AT: "When the leaders of Israel sent messengers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

Since Jephthah was the leader of his army, he and his army are often spoken of as Jephthah himself. AT: "So Jephthah and his army passed through ... Yahweh gave them victory ... they attacked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: So Jephthah passed through ... Yahweh gave him victory ... He attacked

contextId.information: Here Jephthah is referring to the people of Gilead as himself. AT: "do not rescue us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "he" refers to Jephthah and all the fighting men of Gilead. AT: "they fought against Ephraim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "hip and thigh" refers to the whole body. This is a graphic description of how Samson killed the Philistines. AT: "He cut their bodies to pieces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: he cut them to pieces, hip and thigh

contextId.information: Here the word "us" refers to the Philistine people. Those who are talking are not counting themselves among the people whom Samson killed. AT: "who killed many of our people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"with their swords." Here "the sword" represents the swords and other weapons that the soldiers used in battle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "bread" refers to "food." AT: "Eat some food so you will be strong enough to travel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Strengthen yourself with a bit of bread

contextId.information: Here "Israel" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "their brother Benjamin" refers to the surviving descendants of Benjamin. AT: "the surviving Benjamites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here Benjamin refers to the male descendants of Benjamin. AT: "a wife to the men of Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
